intro: Centropogon tessmannii var. tenuiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered centropogon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some ornamental species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
